keyMoments.title: Crashes Into Auction House
keyMoments.description: Luffy crashes through the wall of the Human Auction House riding a flying fish with Zoro, making a dramatic entrance that catches the attention of all present, including fellow Supernovas Law and Kid.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's disregard for conventional approaches and his urgency to rescue Camie.

keyMoments.title: Punches Saint Charlos
keyMoments.description: After witnessing Saint Charlos shoot Hatchan and celebrate the cruelty, Luffy breaks his promise and punches the Celestial Dragon directly in the face, knocking him unconscious and triggering a massive incident.
keyMoments.significance: One of the most iconic moments in One Piece history. Luffy's punch challenges the World Government's authority and demonstrates his unwavering moral compass. This action triggers the dispatch of Admiral Kizaru and sets in motion events leading to the Straw Hats' separation.

reveals.information: Luffy will fight against injustice regardless of the consequences, even breaking promises when moral imperatives demand action

relationships.description: Luffy's friendship with Hatchan is strong enough that he breaks his promise and risks Admiral intervention to defend him.

evolutionMoments.description: Luffy punches a Celestial Dragon after witnessing Charlos shoot Hatchan, demonstrating the depth of his loyalty to his fish-man friend.

keyMoments.title: Reveals Fish-Man Identity to Crowd
keyMoments.description: While trying to stop Luffy from attacking the Celestial Dragons, Hatchan accidentally reveals his six arms and fish-man identity to the entire auction house, triggering immediate discrimination and hatred from the crowd.
keyMoments.significance: Publicly exposes Hatchan to the systemic racism against fish-men and makes him a target for violence. This moment demonstrates the danger fish-men face when their identity is revealed in human society.
keyMoments.quote: Luffy! You promised! You can't attack a Celestial Dragon even if someone is shot right in front of you!

keyMoments.title: Shot by Saint Charlos
keyMoments.description: Saint Charlos shoots Hatchan after learning he is a fish-man, gleefully celebrating that he has obtained a fish-man slave for free.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the casual violence and cruelty of the Celestial Dragons and serves as the catalyst for Luffy's punch.

keyMoments.title: Begs Luffy Not to Retaliate
keyMoments.description: Despite being shot and in pain, Hatchan grabs Luffy and begs him not to attack Charlos, saying he deserves this treatment because of his past crimes and that he only wanted to make amends to Nami.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Hatchan's complete redemption and selflessness. He is willing to suffer to protect Luffy from the consequences of attacking a World Noble.
keyMoments.quote: Luffy, don't! I deserve this... I did terrible things in the past. I just wanted to make it up to Nami...

reveals.information: Hatchan's fish-man identity is publicly revealed to a hostile crowd
Hatchan acknowledges his past crimes and expresses his desire to make amends to Nami

relationships.description: Hatchan seeks to make amends to Nami for his past actions as part of Arlong's crew.

evolutionMoments.description: Hatchan explicitly states that he only wanted to make amends to Nami, even accepting violence against himself as deserved punishment.

keyMoments.title: Bids 500 Million Berries for Camie
keyMoments.description: Charlos interrupts the auction before bidding even starts, placing an astronomical 500 million berry bid for Camie that no one can match, demonstrating the World Nobles' unlimited wealth.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the impossibility of competing with Celestial Dragons through normal means and crushes the Straw Hats' plan to buy Camie's freedom.

keyMoments.title: Shoots Hatchan
keyMoments.description: Upon learning Hatchan is a fish-man, Charlos immediately shoots him and celebrates getting a 'free slave,' displaying extreme cruelty and racism.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the Celestial Dragons' casual violence and complete lack of empathy. This act triggers Luffy's punch.
keyMoments.quote: I just got myself a fish-man slave for free! How lucky!

keyMoments.title: Punched by Luffy
keyMoments.description: After shooting Hatchan and attempting to shoot Luffy, Charlos is punched directly in the face by Luffy, knocked unconscious with a massive fist imprint on his face.
keyMoments.significance: The first time a Celestial Dragon is attacked on-screen, triggering the Celestial Dragon Hit-and-Run Incident and Admiral Kizaru's dispatch.

reveals.information: Charlos displays extreme racism against fish-men and casual cruelty toward all non-nobles

keyMoments.title: Displayed at Auction
keyMoments.description: Camie is brought onto the auction stage in a glass tank and presented as a rare 16-year-old mermaid for sale. She desperately bangs on the tank crying for help but cannot hear anything outside.
keyMoments.significance: Represents the dehumanization of the slave trade and the commodification of rare species. Her helplessness motivates the Straw Hats' rescue attempt.

keyMoments.title: Sold to Saint Charlos
keyMoments.description: Saint Charlos wins Camie with a 500 million berry bid, making it impossible for the Straw Hats to purchase her freedom through legal means.
keyMoments.significance: Forces the Straw Hats to choose between accepting the system or taking direct action.

name.japanese: トラファルガー・ロー

keyMoments.title: Witnesses Luffy's Entrance
keyMoments.description: Law sees Luffy and Zoro crash through the auction house wall and grins widely at their reckless entrance.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Law's interest in and respect for Luffy's unconventional approach.

keyMoments.title: Smiles at Luffy Punching Charlos
keyMoments.description: After Luffy punches Saint Charlos, Law is shown smiling widely at the reckless action, clearly amused and impressed by Luffy's audacity in attacking a World Noble.
keyMoments.significance: Law's positive reaction establishes mutual respect between the Supernovas and foreshadows their future alliance. It shows Law shares Luffy's contempt for the corrupt World Government system.

reveals.information: Law respects those who challenge corrupt authority and shares contempt for the World Noble system

relationships.description: Law develops respect for Luffy after witnessing his attack on a Celestial Dragon.

evolutionMoments.description: Law smiles widely after watching Luffy punch Saint Charlos, showing his approval of Luffy's defiance.

keyMoments.title: Expresses Disgust at Auction
keyMoments.description: Kid comments that he has seen enough of the disgusting slave auction and prepares to leave with his crew before Luffy arrives.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes that Kid, despite being a pirate, has his own moral code and finds the slave trade reprehensible.
keyMoments.quote: I've seen enough. Let's get out of here.

keyMoments.title: Grins at Luffy Punching Charlos
keyMoments.description: After Luffy punches Saint Charlos, Kid grins widely, amused and impressed by Luffy's audacity.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Kid's approval of Luffy's defiance and establishes mutual respect among the Supernovas.

reveals.information: Kid has strong moral objections to slavery and the Celestial Dragon system

keyMoments.title: Chooses Death Over Slavery
keyMoments.description: Lacuba, an ex-pirate who was captured and enslaved, chooses to end his own life rather than continue serving a Celestial Dragon, biting off his own tongue.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes the brutal reality of slavery under the World Nobles and sets the dark tone for the episode.
